column5: Well, it was so nice Saturday I decided I needed a bit of time on the water. I decided that about 12;30 in the afternoon. By 1;30 I had bait and the boat launched. I love having a garage to park the boat in so that its all ready to go.  Well. I fished all over looking for jumbos or eyes. Sad day again. OK, one more spot before I call it quits.  One line down trolling and I decide I'm going to put a second down. Right away the rod on the holder starts to bouncing. Toss the tangled line down and grab the rod. I nail a 3 lb smallmouth. Not what I was gunning for but at least its a fish.  Toss it back, forgot my camera darnitt, and get set up again. One line down and managed to egt the second down this time. Bang, second rod a bouncing. This is a pita, trying to keep on trolling and reel a fish in. I lands a 18" eye. Into the live well you go baby. OK, skip the second line. back to the beginning of the troll patern and put the line down. Not 5 minutes and something wants to rip it out of my hand. Then leaves. Fix the bait and back down again...5 minutes and bang. After a good battle I land a 22 incher. Another couple of misses, one to the boat and drops off and its time to head in for dinner. A nice day on the water.           Then Monday getting toward the end of the work day I decides its a good night to try again. Call up my buddy and see if he feels like going along. OK, 5;15 at my house.  Hitched up and fishing by 6.  6;30 first fish is in the boat.    another 22 incher  sadly that was the only one but I have them tuned in now. Expecting a good season.  It was a nice evening on the water.
sweet dara!  i'm guessin' you're still fishing mary's... lots of water there so it's rewarding when you get them dialed in.
Sweet eyes Dara. Keep em coming,   TDunn
Great job on the eyes and figuring them out That plate of filets looks real good Thanks for sharing Dara!!! Leechman
Nice catches! Dinner looks good. What's with the cleft lip on the last photo? Don't show green peace, they'll blame it on the oil sands.

I have a pretty good grip on him, his gill got smushed up. Almost jumped overboard on me.  Can't wait to get out there again. I figure about 3 times a week for the next month should cover it.  And yes..St Marys area
Nice walleye! Glad to see the OFC'ers are all out catching nice 'eyes.  I've been absolutely nailing them for the past week
Whats nice is no slot or size limit in that area.  You can keep a few nice fish.
Lovely catch.  Looks so delicious all battered up. I think I recognize a couple of those walters lol. Thanks for the report.
mmmmmmm pickerel fry! Its been awhile. Thanks for sharing. Gonna get me some soon!
Doesn't it have to be over 26" to earn the name of "Walter"?  I think that was the rule at Red Pine
